title: A Yandex Extension?!
content: Firefox is not my main browser, I also use Safari and Chrome, but today I opened Firefox and I saw how a "Yandex" extension was downloaded which added "yandex shoping" tag, 2 "Yandex" bookmarks and changed the way the "new tab" looked like. I immediately removed the extension and went straight to here (support page) and guess what? a Tab opened (opened while I was typing. I copied the link: moz-extension://97c991eb-9c43-4225-835e-9635f5fa1988/sovetnik/popup/popup.html) asking me to allow something to "Yandex" Keep in mind that the extension is already deleted! Am I hacked or something? Let Google track my data, Let Mozilla Track my data, but DEFINITLY not russian "Yandex". I am disgusted at what just happened, but regardless I want to know what exactly happened here and what can I now do to stop/prevent this. Thank you Morzilla for being such a safe browser.
creator: kotekipiani5

title: Restoring tabs after crashing
content:
A firefox crash seems to have a corrupted profile, And I'm trying to somehow restore both witch tabs where on what window and what tabs where open, with it being over 1000 or more I want to open them in a new profile in the same windows they where in before, the list is extractable from the data. just getting firefox to open a large list of links in order and know witch one goes with witch windows should be possible. most poste on this are out of date. 3 hours of messing around with this and still nothing.

I would like to know in this link how to do the Save embedded session witch I can't seem to have grayed out, as well as with the "sessionhist(sessionstore(sessionstore_jsonlz4)_json).html" I'd like to know how to see where each window is in the tabs list, and is there a way to make Firefox open a list of tabs from a document, weather naively or an inspect element trick or small script (not an addon something I can't read myself). people seem to say that firefox can open the uncompressed ones it seems like it can't either that or the tool (scrounger) isn't up to date enough.

my session is backed up but when opened or restored crash right as windows start to render (when firefox opens it will open the windows without rendering the details like it should then right as it transitions to starting to render it crashes.) there's an error that shows up when run from the terminal when run from safe mode in this state at time of crashing. seems to be java related.

"ExceptionHandler::GenerateDump cloned child 11238 ExceptionHandler::SendContinueSignalToChild sent continue signal to child ExceptionHandler::WaitForContinueSignal waiting for continue signal... Exiting due to channel error. Exiting due to channel error. Exiting due to channel error."


https://www.jeffersonscher.com/res/scrounger.html

Just getttig my tabs and windows back with out manually doing it would be a huge help. but if it wasn't clear in any of the out puts of this site or using something similar how do I see where it goes from listing one windows tabs to another. this is my first post forgive my formatting.

title: Contact support missing for Anti Certificate Spoofing Firefox add-on
content:
Hi to Mozilla support community,

I have found an interesting Firefox add-on offering Anti-spoofing protection by checking website certificate at the first visit, and then later.

Here is the page: https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/anti-certificate-spoofing/

Having tried to contact the support to ask some questions, it occurs the support email address is not valid (the domain doesn't exist).

On the add-on store, there is only a report button for abuse, but it's not the case here.

Can anyone help to get in touch with the support for this add-on or what to do in such situation?

Many thanks,

Alex

title: Sürekli Güncelleme Kontrolü
content:
Merhaba, 2 gündür Firefox sürekli güncelleme kontrol ediyor. Her açtığımda ediyor, her yeni sekmede tekrar ediyor. İş yapmak azap oldu. Sayfalar bu yüzden geç yükleniyor ya da hiç yüklenmiyor, hata veriyor. Sabah araştıdım ve Sorun Gidermeden tarayıcıyı yeniledim. Sorun değişmedi. Hala devam ediyor.

Üstünde Browsec VNP çalışıyor ama 1 yıldır çalışıyor. Hiç sorun olmamıştı daha önce. Güncellemeyi kaldırmayı denedim ama kaldırma/devreden çıkarma gibi bir seçenek yok. Derdimi çözemiyorum.
creator: bige1

title: Changing colours
content:
Hello!

My toddler got his fingers onto my laptop, and now some colours on my computer have changed. My Firefox default is black text on white background. Now some pages show grey text on black background, which is annoying. This problem doesn't appear on every page. The colour settings seem to be right: black text on white background. Choosing the option "Always replace the colours specified by the page with the options above" changes all backgrounds black. Which is the opposite of my chosen options. I don't understand.

Also the file explorer on Windows, and for example Paint-program has now black background on some parts. I was not able to change it either. I tried opening the problematic web pages on Microsoft Edge, and it seems to show the colours normally.

Can someone help me please?
creator: annuliina.ikaheimo

title: Does Firefox support local CRLs?
content:
Hi,

Does anyone know if Firefox can check the revocation status of a certificate using a local CRL (either installed in the NSS database or anywhere on the system) for a given CA instead of using an external OCSP server?

I read that the NSS database can contain CRL objects but I'm not sure that Firefox uses them.

Thanks in advance.
